mva2.adapter.util

Class InfiniteLoadingHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • mva2.adapter.util.InfiniteLoadingHelper

  • public abstract class InfiniteLoadingHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to add infinite loading feature into the adapter

    • Constructor Detail

      • InfiniteLoadingHelper

        public InfiniteLoadingHelper(RecyclerView recyclerView,
                             int layoutId)
        Parameters:
        layoutId - Layout resource id - The layout which needs to be shown when the page is loading.

      • InfiniteLoadingHelper

        public InfiniteLoadingHelper(RecyclerView recyclerView,
                             int layoutId,
                             int totalPageCount)
        Parameters:
        layoutId - Layout resource id - The layout which needs to be shown when the page is loading.
        totalPageCount - - Total pages that needs to be loaded. By default it will be taken as Integer.MAX_VALUE

    • Method Detail

      • markAllPagesLoaded

        public void markAllPagesLoaded()
        To stop the infinite loading. This method will remove the loading indicator from the adapter.

      • markCurrentPageLoaded

        public void markCurrentPageLoaded()

        To set the current page as loaded. The helper class will not call loadNextPage(int), unless the current page is marked as loaded.

      • setPageCount

        public void setPageCount(int totalPageCount)
        Set the page count for infinite loading progress. Pages indicates that how many times the infinite loading should be called. If the page count is unknown, infinite loading will happen continuously.
        Parameters:
        totalPageCount - Page count for the infinite loading progress

      • onLoadNextPage

        public abstract void onLoadNextPage(int page)
        Abstract callback when the RecyclerView is scrolled and the next page has to be loaded
        Parameters:
        page - Page number

      • getItemBinder

        public final ItemBinder<java.lang.String,ItemViewHolder<java.lang.String>> getItemBinder()
        Internal method. Should not be used by clients.
        Returns:
        ItemBinder which represents the loading indicator

      • setFooterSection

        public final void setFooterSection(ItemSection<java.lang.String> footerSection)
